reviews.headline: Visible improvements in about a week
reviews.comments: I would never have thought to take photos because I didn't expect such good results, but I had some unusual skin texture and blemish flareups that this improved within just a week of use. Within two weeks my skin was totally back to normal. I always followed with a hydrating serum and SPF moisturizer (AM) or squalane oil (PM) and never had issues with peeling or drying.

reviews.headline: It works well for me
reviews.comments: I was hesitant to try this product but it has helped with my acne and red cheeks. It does not irritate my skin and no harsh smell either. I just purchased my second bottle today which lasted me for a good amount. Worth the price and I will continue to repurchase.

Sometimes it can dry me out too much though, so i use a good moisturizing sunscreen to help with that.

reviews.headline: This is incredible.
reviews.comments: My skin care routine is quite simple (cleanser, toner, a serum occasionally, moisturizer, and sunscreen) so I don't use anything to exfoliate my face. I just started using this clarifying toner and it's cleared up so much texture already. I love it!

reviews.headline: Wasn't good for me
reviews.comments: Let me start off by saying I don't even have sensitive skin. I used it for 4 weeks, no change. This product dried my face out so bad. I now have dry patches on my face and my face is now flaky. Also have tiny bumps all over my forehead and cheeks. The last week that I used it I started getting a buring sensation. Im not saying its a bad product but it sure wasn't for me.

reviews.headline: It works butâ€¦

I used it for half a year and once my acne cleared up I stopped using it. I used it again and I felt my face BURNING while i went to sleep. It messed with my skin barrier baddd. I thought it was the face wash or spot treatment from the effaclar line but it turned out to be the toner.

reviews.headline: Don't Think. Just Buy!
reviews.comments: I have oily and acne prone skin. I started using this and I immediately saw a difference, especially in the day time. I use to always see my pores after a few hours but this right with the La Roche Posay moisturizer with SPF, works amazing.

faceoff_positive.comments: I developed horrendous menopausal acne and had tried a 100 and one options. I recently cleaned out my bathroom cabinets and got rid of at least 30 useless products. Why were they useless? Mostly because I am very sensitive - and they contained harsh products - so I tried charcoal and banana skin and honey and they all calmed but didn't cure and I tried other stronger Effaclar products but they were too strong but the amazing Clariyling solution is fantastic - it is only 0.5 salysilic and that is just the amount my skin can bear and you have no idea how the improvement in my skin is uplifting me - I can look at myself again and see the pretty girl I used to be - thankyou so much.
faceoff_positive.headline: When you almost give up.

faceoff_negative.comments: As far as chemical exfoliants go, this stuff is very well tolerated by my sensitive skin (no burning, tingling, or redness.) Because of this I was sooo happy and thought I'd *finally* found a toner I can tolerate. However, I was using this on my chest, neck, and face maybe 2-3 times a week and I noticed that I was developing little acne breakouts after using this product, and I think it could be because of the hydrogenated castor oil included in the formula. Bummer. I really liked the strength of the glycolic acid and the low salicylic acid content, but I'll have to keep looking for a suitable toner.
faceoff_negative.headline: Might be breaking me out
